conclusion: To solve the problem, I will analyze the forces acting on each block and use the principle of conservation of momentum to determine the static friction force on block D. I will calculate the acceleration of the blocks and then find the static friction force.

The image shows four identical wooden blocks placed on a smooth horizontal surface. Blocks B and C are connected by a light spring, and a horizontal pulling force F is applied to block B. The blocks accelerate together with the same acceleration due to the applied force and the static friction force on block D.

premise: The blocks are identical and accelerate together.
The pulling force F is applied to block B.
conclusion: The acceleration of the system is given by \(a = \frac{F}{m}\), where \(m\) is the mass of one block.

premise: The blocks are connected by a spring.
conclusion: The force applied to block B is transmitted to block C, and so on, resulting in all blocks accelerating together.

premise: The static friction force \(f_s\) on block D must balance the force applied to block B to maintain the same acceleration.
conclusion: The static friction force \(f_s\) is equal to the pulling force \(F\).
The mass of block D is also \(m\).

premise: The magnitude of the static friction force \(f_s\) is given by \(f_s = m \times a = m \times \frac{F}{m} = F\).
conclusion: The magnitude of the static friction force acting on block D during the acceleration process is F.
